revised_title: Resonance Scattering Techniques in Atomic Spectroscopy
tldr: The article discusses various resonance scattering techniques used in atomic spectroscopy, focusing on the advancements enabled by tunable-laser technology. Techniques covered include collimated-atomic-beam spectroscopy, Doppler-free two-photon absorption, and quantum-beat measurements. The article provides examples of applications and experimental setups, highlighting the potential of these methods for studying atomic systems and their energy structures.
